subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Role of Fatigue
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Role of Fatigue usable.

hook.text: Most gym injuries happen in the last few reps. Fatigue doesn't just slow you down â€” it removes your protection.

buildup.text: Fresh muscles absorb force efficiently. Fatigued muscles lose their ability to stabilize and protect joints.

discovery.text: Fatigue alters movement patterns. Your form breaks down subtly, shifting stress to vulnerable structures.

twist.text: Cumulative fatigue across weeks matters too. Under-recovered bodies enter each session with reduced capacity.

climax.text: Managing fatigue â€” through rest, deloads, and sleep â€” is injury prevention, not laziness.

punchline.text: Fatigue changes how you move. And how you move determines what breaks.

quiz.question: Why does fatigue increase injury risk?
options: It impairs muscle stability and alters movement patterns
It strengthens joints beyond their capacity
Fatigue has no effect on injury risk
